intro: Darea disticha, commonly known as the two-branched bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color and bloom in the summer months. Darea disticha is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and alpine landscapes.
